channel.title: Few questions
channel.description:
A few questions I want to know.
- 1. How do you get mapdata from RS?
- 2. How would I add the mapdata into my client?
- 3. Do I take it from the cache or from somewhere else?
I would appreciate it if someone could answer these for me and then elaborate on it a little. I'm trying to add GWD but I'm not quite sure how.
- Thanks.

item.title: Few questions
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

yes

you would put the actionbuttonID as a case in clickingmost.java (if you have delta)

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Is the actionButton ID needed for the client when making the interface? I’ll give you an example. If I had this code server sided:

[code] if(!summon) {
switch(actionButtonId) {
case 33206: //Attack stat (maybe interface ID)
teleportToX = 3253;
teleportToY = 3436;
break;

				case 33209: //Strength stat (maybe interface ID)
					teleportToX = 3253;
					teleportToY = 3436;
					break;

				case 33212: //Defence Stat
					teleportToX = 3253;
					teleportToY = 3436;
					break;

				case 33215: //Range Stat						
					teleportToX = 2675; 
					teleportToY = 3422;
					break;

				case 33218: //Prayer Stat
					break;

				case 33221: //Magic Stat
					teleportToX = 2675; 
					teleportToY = 3422;
					break;

				case 33224: //Runecrafting Stat
					teleportToX = 3041;
					teleportToY = 4832;
					break;

				case 33207: //Hitpoints Stat
					teleportToX = 3253;
					teleportToY = 3436;
					break;

				case 33210: //Agility Stat
					teleportToX = 3003;
					teleportToY = 3934;
					break;

				case 33213: //Herblore Stat
					break;

				case 33216: //Theiving Stat
					teleportToX = 2659;
					teleportToY = 3308;
					break;

				case 33219: //Crafting Stat
					heightLevel = 0;
					teleportToX = 2933;
					teleportToY = 3285;
					break;

				case 33222: //Fletching Stat
					break;

				case 47130: //Slayer Stat
					teleportToX = 3266;
					teleportToY = 3417;
					break;

				case 33208: //Mining Stat
					//teleportToX = 2705;
					//teleportToY = 9758;
					break;

				case 33211: //Smithing Stat
					teleportToX = 3288;
					teleportToY = 9189;						
					break;

				case 33214: //Fishing Stat
					teleportToX = 2603;
					teleportToY = 3414;
					break;

				case 33217: //Cooking Stat
					teleportToX = 2817;
					teleportToY = 3443;
					break;

				case 33220: //Firemaking Stat
					break;

				case 33223: //Woodcutting Stat
					teleportToX = 2534;
					teleportToY = 3511;
					break;

				case 54104: //Farming Stat
					break;[/code]

Would the case #### be the interface ID needed for each stat icon? As in, if I had case 33206: which is for attack, would I use 33206 to get the attack sprite to show on the interface of the skills interface tab (3917)?

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

oh oh!

you mean the tabs next to it, your talking about an actionbutton ID, those can easily be obtained by adding a simple bit of code into your server.
if you are using delta, this code will print the actionbutton id into the command prompt.
go into client.java and search for case 185 and add this under it

			// clicking most buttons
			actionButtonId =  misc.HexToInt(inStream.buffer, 0, packetSize);
			if (!validClient)
				break;
			if(playerRights >= 1){
			println("ab=" + actionButtonId);
			}
			if (!antiHax())
				break;
				resetAction();
				server.clickingMost.clicking(playerId);
				break;

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Lol, close, but not correct. That’s for the tab ID of the stat’s interface. I’m talking about each and every sprite interface. Such as strength, prayer, attack, mining, cooking, fire making, etc. For each stat there is an interface ID. The 3917 is the main tab interface. The sprites (mining, cooking, and all that) are loaded into the tab interface of 3917. I’m wondering what each individual ID for each sprite/button.

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

oh, umm i think i might know it, gimme a sec

its either 3917 or 8714

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Defence, attack, strength, prayer, cooking, woodcutting, etc, are all stat icons. When you click on the stats tab, the stats will show, showing you the stat icons. I was wondering what the interface ID is for each stat icon because I wanted to make a new interface for the stats tab and all the others.

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

hmm, explain stat icons,

but for real gwd, you would need all the GWD models for a start, and if you are loading it through mapdata im not sure how u woul d make it work because im sure u couldnt replace it, youd have to add everything.

as for that theres an easier way, its swats new map loading through configs, not sure if he released it here but you can find his tut on rune server

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Wow, thanks. Answered them all for me, great! Two more questions. Would you happen to know how to get GWD onto the client? As in get the actual area onto it? As well as would you know the interface IDs for the stat icons? I’m pretty confused on what they would be…

Read full topic

item.title: Few questions
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

good questions,

  • 1: People have released clients that dump the mapdata (beware, some might still be with XTEA)

  • 2: you have to get the mapdata file and replace it in the main_file_cache.idx4

  • 3: you can take it from other cache’s or download it from people (Beware, it most likely will have XTEA in it)

with taking it form the cache, just open main_file_cache.idx4 (preferably in toms cache suite) and find the mapdata file that you want to replace (you must know what number the mapdata is)

Read full topic
